intro: Caconapea axillaris, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Caconapea axillaris thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
